lead_paragraph: Red Wings center Greg Johnson, who had a hereditary heart abnormality diagnosed during his training camp physical, announced his retirement yesterday. Johnson, 35, played for 12 seasons and signed with Detroit as a free agent after playing with the Nashville Predators for most of his career. He scored 145 goals and 224 assists in 785 games.
